column4: Just installed pidgin 2.0.2 debian package, but need to know how to add it to the menu
Snow, what do I do in that menu...don't see anything to add programs to the menu
system -> prefs -> main menu, sorry
then on the left, click where you which mean you want to put it in, probably internet, then click new item
your using the latest gnome tho right?
haha its ok, do this, run "sudo apt-get update" then "sudo apt-get upgrade"
the upgrade will take a little longer, but will upgrade you to the latest of everything you have
that probably didnt really help the problem at hand, but whatever, still a good thing to do, one sec
do you have a .config folder in your homedir
open term, type "cd ~/.config/menus/"
does that work?
iv never used anything but 7.04 so im not sure, im basically guessing here
ok
im so confused here, i dont see how your system menu can be different than mine
yea but still, iv been looking at dapper guides
i cannot find one specifically for dapper and changing menu items, other than the ~/.config/menus/ thing
maybe go back in there, look at the one you did have
maybe create an applications.menu file and add just pidgin into it
most likely /usr/bin/
you find the path?
odd, give it another try, let me know how it goes
it looks like those files are just xml files that the menu uses
haha nice
np
